content.p:
ยง 3063. State emergency medical advisory committee. 1. The state
emergency medical advisory committee, in addition to the powers and
responsibilities described in section three thousand two-a of this
chapter, shall advise the department and the commissioner regarding
emergency medical care, and assist the department and the commissioner
in the development, periodic revision, and application of
appropriateness review standards and quality improvement guidelines for
emergency medical care, emergency departments and emergency services,
under articles twenty-eight and thirty of this chapter.
 2. The commissioner shall designate an officer or employee of the
department to assist the state emergency medical advisory committee in
the performance of its duties under this section.
